doc.title: Whitespace

value.content:
Whitespace refers to characters which are used to provide horizontal or vertical space between other characters. Whitespace is often used to separate tokens in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and other computer languages.

Whitespace characters and their usage vary among languages.

value.title: In HTML
value.content: The Infra Living Standard defines five characters as "ASCII whitespace": U+0009 TAB, U+000A LF, U+000C FF, U+000D CR, and U+0020 SPACE.

value.title: In JavaScript
value.content: The ECMAScript Language Specification defines several Unicode codepoints as "white space": U+0009 CHARACTER TABULATION <TAB>, U+000B LINE TABULATION <VT>, U+000C FORM FEED <FF>, U+0020 SPACE <SP>, U+00A0 NO-BREAK SPACE <NBSP>, U+FEFF ZERO WIDTH NO-BREAK SPACE <ZWNBSP>, and any other Unicode "Space_Separator" code points <USP>.
